channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Je suis monté à bord de la Zeekr 7GT : pourquoi cette voiture électrique qui recharge en 13 minutes m’a mis une claque
item.description: Après des mois d'attente, la Zeekr 7GT arrive enfin en Europe. Cette voiture électrique promet un style spectaculaire, des technologies dernier cri, une recharge ultra-rapide... et elle sera bientôt vendue en France. Voici mes premières impressions.

item.title: The World’s Oceans Soaked Up Record-Breaking Heat for the 9th Straight Year
item.description: The global ocean heat content increased yet again in 2025, further raising the risk of catastrophic storms, seal level rise, and coral bleaching.

item.title: The CES 2026 stuff I might actually buy
item.description: Hi, friends! Welcome to Installer No. 111, your guide to the best and Verge-iest stuff in the world. (If you're new here, welcome, hope you had a wonderful holiday season, and also you can read all the old editions at the Installer homepage.) This week, I've been reading about gerrymandering and watch conventions and John […]

item.title: A charity speedrunning event has turned into a perfect showcase for smaller games
item.description: Games Done Quick, the biannual charity speedrunning event currently going on right now, not only helps organizations like the Prevent Cancer Foundation and Doctors Without Borders - it helps indie games get noticed, too. Indie game developers face an incredible uphill battle not only getting their projects funded, completed, and launched, but discovered as well. […]...

item.title: Cette mini borne d’arcade avec 45 jeux perd plus de 40 % de son prix chez Amazon pour les soldes d’hiver
item.description: Entre un design qui tient dans la main et 45 jeux disponibles, cette mini borne d'arcade de la marque Unico pourra vous assurer de longues heures de jeu. Amazon profite des soldes d'hiver pour retirer 41 % de son prix et la faire passer à 59,49 euros.

item.title: Best Deals for New Year’s Resolutions: Sleep, Fitness, and More (2026)
item.description: Whether you’re hitting the gym or tracking your schedule, these discounts on WIRED-approved gear can help.

item.title: I tested the Dezctop Revon Elite - a quality standing desk with modular organization and accessories like I haven’t seen before
item.description: The Dezctop Revon Elite has a simple standing desk design plus a useful magnetic accessory system that allows for organization and tools like no other desk I’ve used offering a whole new layer of features.

item.title: Roborock’s Iconic Wet and Dry Vacuums at Nearly 40% Off to Start Year Right
item.description: The flagship F25 Ultra Wet and Dry Vacuum and the powerful F25 GT are both marked down in a big way, but for a limited time only.

item.title: Fujifilm X-E5 Mirrorless Camera Review: Compact Color Science in a Retro Package
item.description: Did you want the TikTok-popular X100VI, but with an interchangeable lens? The Fujifilm X-E5 has you covered.

item.title: The 50 Best Movies on Netflix, WIRED’s Picks (January 2026)
item.description: Good Night, and Good Luck: Live From Broadway, Frankenstein, and Wake Up Dead Man: A Knives Out Mystery are just a few of the movies you should watch on Netflix this month.

item.title: The 50 Best Shows on Netflix, WIRED's Picks (January 2026)
item.description: Stranger Things, Run Away, and His & Hers are just a few of the shows you need to watch on Netflix this month.

item.title: 5 best phone accessories of CES 2026 — from the practical to the weird
item.description: Loads of exciting smartphone accessories were announced at CES 2026, and these are the very best of them.

item.title: Why Elon Musk is laughing off Grok’s flood of deepfake AI porn
item.description: When you own the regulators, creating sexualized images of women and children isn’t a bug—it’s a business model. From the moment Elon Musk’s artificial intelligence company, xAI, began rolling out its Grok chatbot to paid X subscribers in 2023, it pitched the tool as the bad boy of large language models. Grok would supposedly be authorized to say and do things that its politically correct competitors—primarily ChatGPT, produced by Musk’s old nemeses at OpenAI—would not. ...
